DAX...12253.4...-164.10...-1.30%.16:15 ETDow +28.90 at 27221.35, Nasdaq -36.88 at 8293.33, S&P -4.89 at 3020.97[BRIEFING.COM] The S&P 500 lost 0.2% on Monday, slipping from record highs in a lackluster session. The Nasdaq Composite (-0.4%) and Russell 2000 (-0.6%) both underperformed, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average (+0.1%) managed to finish higher.Monday's session didn't include much price action, as investors appeared to be waiting for several key events later this week. Some of these events will include the FOMC's rate decision, U.S.-China trade talks, the July employment report, and Apple's (AAPL 209.68, +1.94, +0.9%) earnings report. On a related note, Apple's price target was raised to $235 from $225 at UBS before its results after Tuesday's close.Apple shares rose on the increased price target, but the broader market was still weighed down by widely-held shares of Amazon (AMZN 1912.45, -30.60, -1.6%), Facebook (FB 195.94, -3.81, -1.9%), and Alphabet (GOOG 1239.41, -11.00, -0.9%). In turn, the S&P 500 consumer discretionary (-0.6%) and communication services (-0.5%) sectors were among today's laggards but, like the broader market, finished the session off intraday lows.The S&P 500 financials sector (-0.8%) succumbed to broad-based selling interest throughout the day. Wells Fargo (WFC 48.28, -1.02, -2.1%) was a notable laggard amid a Wall Street Journal report indicating that the Trump administration plans to make it harder for deeply indebted borrowers to acquire mortgage loans.On the other hand, the S&P 500 defensive-oriented sectors -- utilities (+0.5%), real estate (+0.5%), health care (+0.4%), and consumer staples (+0.3%) -- were the lone sectors that finished higher.Separately, Mylan N.V. (MYL 20.78, +2.32, +12.6%) agreed to combine with Pfizer's (PFE 41.45, -1.64, -3.8%) off-patent drug business, giving Mylan shareholders 43% of the combined company. On a related note, Mylan N.V. beat top and bottom-line estimates; Pfizer beat earnings estimates but missed revenue estimates.U.S. Treasuries finished the session higher, pushing yields lower across the curve. The 2-yr yield and the 10-yr yield declined three basis points each to 1.84% and 2.06%, respectively. The U.S. Dollar Index finished flat at 98.04. WTI crude increased 1.2% to $56.87/bbl.Investors did not receive any notable economic data on Monday.Looking ahead, Tuesday will feature the Personal Income and Spending report for June, which will include the Fed's preferred inflation gauge -- the PCE Price Index. Investors will also receive the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index for July, Pending Home Sales for June, and the S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for May.Nasdaq Composite +25.0% YTDS&P 500 +20.5% YTDDow Jones Industrial Average +16.7% YTDRussell 2000 +16.4% YTD ..NYSE Adv/Dec 1472/1420. ..NASDAQ Adv/Dec 1183/1867.Briefing.com is the leading Internet provider of live market analysis for U.S. Stock, U.S. Bond and world FX market participants. 1-800-752-3013 or http://www.briefing.comLoad-Date: July 30, 2019End of Document

There hasn't been much buying conviction in the broader market, although the small-cap Russell 2000 (+0.5%) has seen some positive action. The Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 0.2%, and the Nasdaq Composite is down 0.4%.Several factors that have contributed to the negative disposition include President Trump saying there are no signs of China buying U.S. agricultural products, some cautious trading ahead of Apple's (AAPL 208.08, -1.59, -0.8%) earnings report after the close and the Fed's rate decision tomorrow, and the disappointing price action in shares of Beyond Meat (BYND 205.01, -17.12, -7.7%) following its report.Beyond Meat is perhaps more a reflection of how far many stocks, and the stock market to a certain extent, have come in a short period of time. It isn't too surprising to see some broader consolidation -- or to see shares of Beyond Meat attempting a recovery after being down as much as 17% today.The stock market, too, has come off its lows. At this juncture, the utilities (-0.7%), information technology (-0.6%), and consumer discretionary (-0.6%) sectors are underperforming, while the materials (+0.5%), real estate (+0.5%), energy (+0.5%), and consumer staples (+0.4%) sectors are outperforming.In corporate news, Procter & Gamble (PG 121.29, +5.29, +4.6%) and Merck (MRK 83.42, +0.94, +1.1%) both beat top and bottom-line estimates. Shares are up nicely on the results, while shares of fellow Dow component Pfizer (PFE 39.02, -2.44) are down 5.9% after being downgraded at Bank of America/Merrill Lynch and Morgan Stanley. Capital One (COF 89.99, -6.93, -7.2%), meanwhile, is feeling the fallout from a data breach that affected over 100 million customers.Separately, an expectation that interest rates will remain low has prompted Goldman Sachs to raise its S&P 500 2019 year-end target to 3100 and set a 2020 year-end price target of 3400. Currently, the benchmark 10-yr note yield is up one basis point to 2.07%.Reviewing today's economic data, which included the Personal Income and Spending Report for June, the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index for July, the S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for May, and Pending Home Sales for June:Personal income increased 0.4% (Briefing.com consensus 0.4%) while personal spending rose 0.3% (Briefing.com consensus 0.3%) m/m in June. The PCE Price Index was up 0.1%, as expected, and the core PCE price Index, which excludes food and energy, jumped 0.2%, also as expected. On a yr/yr basis, the PCE Price Index held steady at 1.4% while the core PCE Price Index edged up to 1.6% from 1.5% in May.The key takeaway from the report is that it contained decent consumer data and tame inflation data, which is not all that surprising relative to recent data seen of late.The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index surged to 135.7 in July (Briefing.com consensus 125.5) from an upwardly revised 124.3 (from 121.5) in June. That is the highest reading since November 2018 and the third-highest reading since October 2000.The key takeaway from the report is that consumers are optimistic about current and prospective business and labor market conditions, and have improved expectations for their financial outlook. That is a supportive combination that will encourage increased consumer spending activity.The S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for May increased 2.4% (Briefing.com consensus 3.5%) after increasing 2.5% in April.Pending Home Sales increased 1.6% in June (Briefing.com consensus +1.0%). DAX...12253.4...-164.10...-1.30%.16:15 ETDow +28.90 at 27221.35, Nasdaq -36.88 at 8293.33, S&P -4.89 at 3020.97[BRIEFING.COM] The S&P 500 lost 0.2% on Monday, slipping from record highs in a lackluster session. The Nasdaq Composite (-0.4%) and Russell 2000 (-0.6%) both underperformed, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average (+0.1%) managed to finish higher.Monday's session didn't include much price action, as investors appeared to be waiting for several key events later this week. Some of these events will include the FOMC's rate decision, U.S.-China trade talks, the July employment report, and Apple's (AAPL 209.68, +1.94, +0.9%) earnings report. On a related note, Apple's price target was raised to $235 from $225 at UBS before its results after Tuesday's close.Apple shares rose on the increased price target, but the broader market was still weighed down by widely-held shares of Amazon (AMZN 1912.45, -30.60, -1.6%), Facebook (FB 195.94, -3.81, -1.9%), and Alphabet (GOOG 1239.41, -11.00, -0.9%). In turn, the S&P 500 consumer discretionary (-0.6%) and communication services (-0.5%) sectors were among today's laggards but, like the broader market, finished the session off intraday lows.The S&P 500 financials sector (-0.8%) succumbed to broad-based selling interest throughout the day. Wells Fargo (WFC 48.28, -1.02, -2.1%) was a notable laggard amid a Wall Street Journal report indicating that the Trump administration plans to make it harder for deeply indebted borrowers to acquire mortgage loans.On the other hand, the S&P 500 defensive-oriented sectors -- utilities (+0.5%), real estate (+0.5%), health care (+0.4%), and consumer staples (+0.3%) -- were the lone sectors that finished higher.Separately, Mylan N.V. (MYL 20.78, +2.32, +12.6%) agreed to combine with Pfizer's (PFE 41.45, -1.64, -3.8%) off-patent drug business, giving Mylan shareholders 43% of the combined company. On a related note, Mylan N.V. beat top and bottom-line estimates; Pfizer beat earnings estimates but missed revenue estimates.U.S. Treasuries finished the session higher, pushing yields lower across the curve. The 2-yr yield and the 10-yr yield declined three basis points each to 1.84% and 2.06%, respectively. The U.S. Dollar Index finished flat at 98.04. WTI crude increased 1.2% to $56.87/bbl.Investors did not receive any notable economic data on Monday.Looking ahead, Tuesday will feature the Personal Income and Spending report for June, which will include the Fed's preferred inflation gauge -- the PCE Price Index. Investors will also receive the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index for July, Pending Home Sales for June, and the S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for May.Nasdaq Composite +25.0% YTDS&P 500 +20.5% YTDDow Jones Industrial Average +16.7% YTDRussell 2000 +16.4% YTD ..NYSE Adv/Dec 1472/1420. ..NASDAQ Adv/Dec 1183/1867.Briefing.com is the leading Internet provider of live market analysis for U.S. Stock, U.S. Bond and world FX market participants. 1-800-752-3013 or http://www.briefing.comLoad-Date: July 30, 2019End of Document

Trump administration reportedly delays deciding whether to let US companies resume selling to HuaweiBusiness Insider USAugust 9, 2019 Friday 05:40 AM GMTCopyright 2019 Insider Inc. All Rights ReservedLength: 651 wordsByline: feedback@businessinsider.com,  (Rosie Perper)Highlight: The reported move follows China's decision to halt imports of US agricultural goods along with threats to slap additional tariffs on them.BodyREUTERS/Jorge Silva/File photo• US officials are delaying a decision on whether to grant licenses to US companies wishing to resume sales to Huawei, sources familiar with the situation told Bloomberg on Thursday. • The US Department of Commerce added Huawei to a trade blacklist in May, which prevents the company from buying parts and components from US companies without government approval. • Last month, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross announced an easing of restrictions and said he would issue licenses to companies to let them sell once more, subject to national security considerations.• But Bloomberg said this system could be knocked off-track in response to China's escalating the trade war again this week by halting US agricultural imports.• Visit Business Insider's home page for more stories.The White House is delaying a decision on whether to let US companies start selling once more to blacklisted Chinese tech giant Huawei, sources familiar with the situation told Bloomberg on Thursday. Companies were due to be issued licenses to recommence trade with Huawei despite it being placed on a trade blacklist by the Trump administration.But, despite promises of a "timely" delivery, companies are still waiting for approval.The delay in issuing licenses comes as the US continues to shift its policy regarding Huawei, which has found itself in the center of trade war negotiations between China and the US.The Trump administration previously said Huawei technology could pose a national security risk, citing a risk that it could be used as a backdoor for Chinese government espionage.The US Department of Commerce added Huawei to a trade blacklist in May. This prevents the company from buying important parts and components from US companies without government approval.Last month, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross announced an easing of restrictions against Huawei after a meeting between President Donald Trump and Xi Jinping at a G20 summit.Ross said he would issue licenses to companies so long as continued trade with Huawei doesn't present a national security threat.Read more: Trump meets with top US tech leaders to discuss sales to Huawei as he moves to soften restrictions against the Chinese tech giantSeveral firms, including major chipmaker Intel, have already applied for licenses, which Trump said would be processed in a "timely" manner. Ross            recently said that he expected to deliver a verdict on around 50 applications soon."We are interested in getting them all together to see them as a unified bloc," he said last month. According to Bloomberg, the delay was a response to China's announcement this week that it will halt imports of US agricultural goods. The embargo came alongside threats of additional tariffs on US agricultural produce.China's announcement was part of a series of tit-for-tat moves made as trade talks between the world's largest economies begin to stumble. Last week, Trump said the US would expand tariffs to virtually all imports from China starting on September 1. Trump previously said China was "letting us down" by refusing to buy US agricultural goods and that it hadn't kept promises it made during trade talks. "China is letting us down in that they have not been buying the agricultural products from our great Farmers that they said they would," Trump wrote on Twitter last month. "Hopefully they will start soon!"NOW WATCH: 5 things wrong with Apple's lightning cableSee Also:• Tech's 5 FAANG stocks just saw $150 billion of their market value vaporized, and Apple is reeling the hardest• Chinese state media says Huawei is testing a smartphone with its homegrown HongMeng operating system to rival Google's Android OS• Peter Thiel just cranked up his attack on Google's 'naive' relationship with China in a blistering New York Times op-edSEE ALSO: Intel says it's been selling tech to Huawei as the US eases up on the Chinese companyLoad-Date: August 9, 2019End of Document

The award includes a joint URF and SPS EPCI solution, comprising a new subsea well gathering system (GS4), tied back to the existing central processing facility. In addition to the GS4 scope, the award includes in-fill URF EPCI scope involving the development of new subsea wells tied-in to the existing gathering systems. Water depths in the field range from 787 to 885 feet.16:47ACCO ACCO Brands beats by $0.04, beats on revs; raises FY19 guidance (8.14 -0.02)Reports Q2 (Jun) earnings of $0.36 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.04 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.32; revenues rose 4.0% year/year to $518.7 mln vs the $493.89 mln S&P Capital IQ Consensus. In this study, UBX0101 was well-tolerated. Improvement in several clinical outcomes, including pain and function, as well as modulation of certain senescence-associated secretory phenotype (SASP) factors and disease-related biomarkers was observed after a single dose. UNITY plans to initiate a Phase 2 study of UBX0101 in patients with painful, moderate-to-severe OA of the knee. The study is expected to enroll approx. 180 patients, with initiation expected in Q4 of 2019 and initial 12-week results expected in the second half of 2020. This will be a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study evaluating three doses (0.5mg, 2mg, and 4mg) of UBX0101 administered via a single intra-articular injection. The primary measure will be an assessment of pain at 12 weeks using the WOMAC-A instrument. Secondary measures will include safety and tolerability, pain, and function at 12 weeks, as well as similar measures at 24 weeks. In addition, UNITY plans to study the safety, tolerability, and initial effectiveness of both a new higher dose and repeat doses in a parallel Phase 1B study. Details of that study will be forthcoming.16:32ALL Allstate beats by $0.63, reports revs in-line (101.83 +0.02)Reports Q2 (Jun) earnings of $2.18 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.63 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $1.55; revenues rose 6.2% year/year to $8.99 bln vs the $8.96 bln S&P Capital IQ Consensus.16:31AAPL Apple: Co reports Q3 services gross margins of 64.1% vs ests of slight improvement from last quarter of 63.8%16:31UNM Unum Group beats by $0.01, reports revs in-line (32.80 +0.30)Reports Q2 (Jun) earnings of $1.36 per share, $0.01 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $1.35; revenues rose 4.4% year/year to $3.02 bln vs the $2.99 bln S&P Capital IQ Consensus.Co continues expecting after-tax adjusted operating income growth per share between 4% and 7% for FY19.16:31AAPL Apple: Co sees Q4 gross margins of 37.5-38.5% vs ests of 38.3% vs 38.3% last year.16:30AAPL Apple: Co reports Q3 gross margin of 37.3% vs ests of 38.1% vs 38.3% last year.16:30MDU MDU Resources beats by $0.03, reports revs in-line; guides FY19 EPS in-line (26.17 +0.14)Reports Q2 (Jun) earnings of $0.31 per share, $0.03 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.28; revenues rose 22.4% year/year to $1.3 bln vs the $1.3 bln single analyst estimate. The company also anticipates adjusted EBITDA as a percentage of revenues in a range of 12.0% to 12.5% and non-GAAP adjusted diluted earnings per share to increase 15% to 25% over 2018.16:15WRAPX Closing Stock Market SummaryThe stock market wavered mostly in negative territory on Tuesday, leaving the S&P 500 (-0.3%), Dow Jones Industrial Average (-0.1%), and Nasdaq Composite (-0.2%) with slight losses. There weren't too many positive catalysts for the broader market, but the small-cap Russell 2000 did advance 1.1% to finish near session highs.The S&P 500's worst levels of the day came shortly after the open, as investors appeared uninterested to participate in the action in front of Apple's (AAPL 208.78, -0.90, -0.4%) earnings report after the close and the FOMC's rate decision tomorrow. President Trump alleging that China has yet to buy U.S. agricultural products added to the negative tone.Still, aside from some profit taking in hot-flying stocks like Beyond Meat (BYND 194.76, -27.37, -12.3%) and Under Armour (UAA 24.08, -3.36, -12.2%) following their earnings reports, there was no serious interest to withdraw from the broader market. At its low, the S&P 500 was down 0.7% and hanging just above the 3000 level, where it would firmly stay above the rest of the day.The final standings reflected a mixed session with five S&P 500 sectors finishing higher and six sectors finishing lower. The utilities (-0.8%), information technology (-0.7%), and consumer discretionary (-0.7%) sectors underperformed, while the energy (+1.1%), real estate (+0.9%), and materials (+0.6%) sectors finished on top.Energy stocks gained traction as oil prices ($58.05, +1.18, +2.1%) made a big move in the afternoon on no confirmed news catalyst. The noticeable gain today could have been derived from speculation that the Fed's expected rate cut tomorrow could increase demand for oil.In other corporate news, Procter & Gamble (PG 120.41, +4.41, +3.8%) and Merck (MRK 83.27, +0.78, +1.0%) pleased investors with their earnings results. Pfizer (PFE 38.79, -2.66) fell 6.4% after the stock was downgraded at both Bank of America/Merrill Lynch and Morgan Stanley. Capital One (COF 91.21, -5.71) fell 5.9% after disclosing a data breach that affected over 100 million customers.U.S. Treasuries finished slightly lower in another muted session. The 2-yr yield and the 10-yr yield increased one basis point each to 1.85% and 2.06%, respectively. The U.S. Dollar Index finished unchanged at 98.05.Reviewing Tuesday's economic data, which included the Personal Income and Spending Report for June, the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index for July, the S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for May, and Pending Home Sales for June:Personal income increased 0.4% (Briefing.com consensus 0.4%) while personal spending rose 0.3% (Briefing.com consensus 0.3%) m/m in June. The PCE Price Index was up 0.1%, as expected, and the core PCE price Index, which excludes food and energy, jumped 0.2%, also as expected. On a yr/yr basis, the PCE Price Index held steady at 1.4% while the core PCE Price Index edged up to 1.6% from 1.5% in May.The key takeaway from the report is that it contained decent consumer data and tame inflation data, which is not all that surprising relative to recent data seen of late.The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index surged to 135.7 in July (Briefing.com consensus 125.5) from an upwardly revised 124.3 (from 121.5) in June. That is the highest reading since November 2018 and the third-highest reading since October 2000.The key takeaway from the report is that consumers are optimistic about current and prospective business and labor market conditions, and have improved expectations for their financial outlook. That is a supportive combination that will encourage increased consumer spending activity.The S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for May increased 2.4% (Briefing.com consensus 3.5%) after increasing 2.5% in April.Pending Home Sales increased 1.6% in June (Briefing.com consensus +1.0%). Today's reading follows an unrevised increase of 1.1% in May.Looking ahead, investors will receive the FOMC rate decision, the ADP Employment Change report for July, the Chicago PMI for July, the Employment Cost Index for the second quarter, and the weekly MBA Mortgage Applications Index on Wednesday.Nasdaq Composite +24.7% YTDS&P 500 +20.2% YTDRussell 2000 +17.6% YTDDow Jones Industrial Average +16.6% YTD16:15EPD Enterprise Products announces long-term agreements with Chevron (CVX) subsidiary Chevron U.S.A. (29.39 +0.13)Enterprise Products and Chevron U.S.A. announced long-term agreements supporting the development of Enterprise's Sea Port Oil Terminal in the Gulf of Mexico. Enterprise's SPOT project consists of onshore and offshore facilities, including a fixed platform located approx. 30 nautical miles off the Brazoria County, Texas coast in approx. 115 feet of water. SPOT is designed to load Very Large Crude Carriers (VLCCs) at rates of approx. 85,000 barrels per hour, or up to approx. 2 mln barrels per day. The SPOT design also meets or exceeds federal requirements and, unlike existing and other proposed offshore terminals, is designed with a vapor control system to minimize emissions. The long-term agreements with Chevron support Enterprise's final investment decision. Enterprise Products and Cheron U.S.A. also announced the execution of long-term agreements for crude oil transportation, storage, and marine terminaling services. This suite of agreements, together with other customer agreements, support expansion of Enterprise's crude oil system from the Permian Basin to Enterprise's ECHO terminal in Houston, Texas. HIV product sales were $4.0 billion for the second quarter of 2019 compared to $3.7 billion for the same period in 2018. The increase was primarily driven by higher sales volume as a result of the continued uptake of Biktarvy (bictegravir 50 mg/emtricitabine 200 mg/tenofovir alafenamide 25 mg). Chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) product sales were $842 million for the second quarter of 2019 compared to $1.0 billion for the same period in 2018. The decline was primarily due to competitive dynamics, including a decline in U.S. Medicare prices, and lower patient starts. Yescarta (axicabtagene ciloleucel) generated $120 million in sales during the second quarter of 2019 compared to $68 million for the same period in 2018. We received the first new order for the phase 2 buildout of OLED production capacity. This is a welcome development given our competitive positioning in a cycle that could extend as far as 2023. In materials processing, headwinds strengthened during the quarter due to a combination of weakening macro demand, continued pressure from tariffs and aggressive discounting in China from domestic and foreign competitors. Reinvigorating demand and resolving tariffs requires government actions. Addressing the competitive dynamic is based upon products and applications, which led us to put greater emphasis on welding and joining where invention and process IP is still being created," said John Ambroseo, President and CEO of Coherent. "We are also taking steps to improve the overall efficiency of our business. We have launched two site consolidation projects that we expect to generate approximately $24 million in annual run rate savings upon completion," Ambroseo added.16:04AKAM Akamai Tech beats by $0.07, beats on revs, guides on callReports Q2 (Jun) earnings of $1.07 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.07 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $1.00; revenues rose 6.4% year/year to $705.07 mln vs the $695.88 mln S&P Capital IQ Consensus.Note: CO typically guides on the call, starts at 4:30pm ET.16:03ADSW Advanced Disposal misses by $0.08, beats on revs (32.54 +0.06)Reports Q2 (Jun) earnings of $0.10 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.08 worse than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.18; revenues rose 5.3% year/year to $419.1 mln vs the $413.26 mln S&P Capital IQ Consensus.16:03LSCC Lattice Semi beats by $0.04, beats on revs; guides Q3 revs in-line (16.41 +0.03)Reports Q2 (Jun) earnings of $0.15 per share, $0.04 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.11; revenues fell 0.4% year/year to $102.3 mln vs the $99.72 mln S&P Capital IQ Consensus. The company guided for FY19 operating loss of EUR (340)-(180) mln, revenue up 21-29% to EUR 6.35-6.80 bln, MAU +18-28% to 245-265 mln, premium subs +21-32% to 117-127 mln and gross margin of 22.0-25.0%.First quarter operating loss, premium subs, and gross margin came in better than the company's outlook; monthly active users (MAUs) were near the midpoint of guidance. Revenue upside came from successful promotions in the US and Canada, strength in family plans, and promotions with Google and Hulu. Marketing partnerships are helping to drive subscriber growth. At the same time, average revenue per user (ARPU) declines connected to product and geographic mix moderated.Competition from Apple Music and Amazon in the US are a concern.The company has a ~$28 bln market cap. The stock trades at ~3.7x 2019 estimates. Spotify also has a 17% stake in Tencent Music (TME), which is worth almost $5 bln. The valuation discount to other high-quality software subscription businesses reflects the company's poor margin profile given the hefty licensing fees paid to music labels. Podcasting investments (original content) hope to increase subs and engagement but are weighing on margins near term.15:35MAXR Maxar Technologies Ltd one of ten companies selected by NASA for 19 partnerships to mature industry-developed space technologies and help maintain American leadership in space (7.90 +0.32)NASA Release15:27SUMRX Earnings out this afternoon/tomorrow morningThis afternoon: AAPL ACHC ADSW AKAM ALL AMD AMGN APAM ARCB ASH ATEN ATRC AX AXS BEAT BLKB BXP BYD CACC CCS CDAY CHRW CINF CNO COHR CRY CSLT DENN DLR EA EGHT ENPH EQR EXP EXR FCPT FEYE FMC FTSI GILD GNW GRPN HA HR HUBG HURN HVT HY IMAX INVH IRWD KAI KBR KL LDL LNDC LSCC MC MDLZ MDU MGRC MKSI MOH MRCY MSTR MX MXIM NANO NATI NCR NR NUVA OKE PAYC PSA QGEN QUAD REXR RPAI RRD RTEC RXN SIMO SOI STAG SYKE SYX TCS TENB TRUP TTOO TWOU TX UDR UIS UMBF UNM VNOM VRSK WES WIRE YUMC ZEN Tomorrow morning: ACCO ADP AMCX AMRN AMT APO APTV ARES ASC BDC BG BHGE BLMN BTU CBZ CDW CG CHD CIM CLH CME CRL CRTO D DAN DIN EAF ECA EPD ETR EXTR FCAU FOE FSS GE GIB GLDD GRMN HEP HES HPP HSC HUM ICL JCI JHG KFRC LFUS LHX LIVN MCO MDC MGPI MTOR NI NLSN NYCB ORBC RDWR SAIA SBH SITE SMG SO SPG SPOT SPR SSYS STNG STRA TAP TGI TKR TMHC TNC TPB UTHR WLTW WNC15:22GILD Gilead Sciences to report Q2 results after the close (67.10 -0.77)Gilead will report its Q2 results after the close and has a conference call scheduled for 4:30 PM ET.Current estimates call for the company to report Non-GAAP EPS of $1.71 on revenues of $5.54 bln (-2% yr/yr). For 2019, Gilead's guidance currently calls for net product sales of $21.3-21.8 bln. This guidance reflects the anticipated entry of generic versions of Letairis and Ranexa in the United States and the full year impact of generic products containing tenofovir disoproxil fumarate in certain European countries. In Q1, U.S. sales were down 15% sequentially due to the anticipated inventory drawdown associated with their HIV products, reflective of the seasonal inventory pattern from Q4 to Q1. In-line with company expectations, HIV payer mix moved more toward public payers, which also contributed to the sequential decline.In early July, Gilead & Galapagos (GLPG) announced their entry into a 10-year global research and development collaboration through which Galapagos will receive a $3.95 bln upfront payment and $1.1 bln equity investment from Gilead. In turn, Gilead will gain access to a portfolio of compounds, including six molecules currently in clinical trials, more than 20 preclinical programs and a proven drug discovery platform. The agreement also includes a 10-year standstill restricting Gilead's ability to seek to acquire Galapagos or increase its stake in Galapagos beyond 29.9%. In mid-July, the company announced that John McHutchison, AO, MD, Chief Scientific Officer and Head of Research & Development, had decided to leave the company, effective next month. The company said it would immediately commence a search for his successor. McHutchison joined Gilead in 2010.Following a recent meeting with the FDA, the company said a path forward has been established to submit the NDA for filgotinib as a treatment for rheumatoid arthritis in 2019. Look for the company to elaborate on this during today's callGilead currently has a market cap of $86 bln and trades at a P/E of 10x & P/S of 3.9x. Earlier this week, RBC upgraded Gilead to "Top Pick" from "Outperform" with a $91 price target, describing the valuation disconnect as too big to ignore. Treasuries lurched higher at the start of today's cash session, but that push was short-lived and followed by a slip into negative territory. The early losses were widened after the release of better than expected Consumer Confidence for July (actual 135.7; Briefing.com consensus 125.5) and Pending Home Sales for June (actual 2.8%; Briefing.com consensus 1.0%), but it wasn't long before Treasuries found support and trimmed their losses. Today's fairly quiet session preceded tomorrow's FOMC Statement, which the market expects to herald the start of a new easing cycle. The fed funds futures market is certain that a 25 bps rate cut will take place tomorrow while the implied likelihood of a 50 bps cut sits at 21.9% after climbing above 60.0% two weeks ago. Meanwhile, former New York Fed President William Dudley penned a column for Bloomberg, suggesting that the FOMC could stop after just one rate cut. The U.S. Dollar Index returned to its flat line in the afternoon after marking another fresh high for the month in overnight trade. The key takeaway from the report is that it contained decent consumer data and tame inflation data, which is not all that surprising relative to recent data seen of late. The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index surged to 135.7 in July (Briefing.com consensus 125.5) from an upwardly revised 124.3 (from 121.5) in June. That is the highest reading since November 2018 and the third-highest reading since October 2000. The key takeaway from the report is that consumers are optimistic about current and prospective business and labor market conditions, and have improved expectations for their financial outlook. That is a supportive combination that will encourage increased consumer spending activity. The S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index increased 2.4% yr/yr in May after a 2.5% increase in April. Pending Home Sales increased 2.8% in June (Briefing.com consensus 1.0%) after increasing 1.1% in May. The high-flying commerce platform developer has exceeded analysts' top and bottom line expectations in every quarter since its May 2015 IPO.Additionally, while its growth rate has tapered off, SHOP's revenue growth is still remarkably high despite becoming a $1 bln+ company. Over the past four quarters, revenue growth has drifted lower from 60% to 50%.SHOP's exceptional performance relative to expectations, combined with its high double-digit revenue growth has made it a premier growth stock. And, the stock has a valuation to prove it, trading at an exorbitant 17.7x expected FY20 sales.Through its basic offering, users can manage products and inventory, process payments, access data and analytics, and communicate with customers. SHOP has been building onto its core offerings by launching Shopify Shipping and Shopify Capital, which provides cash advances and loans to business owners.Furthermore, the company has been focused on growing its premium (and higher priced) Shopify Plus product, which caters more to larger and high-volume customers. Plus offers all the basic capabilities, but it includes add-ons like apps such as Script, Launchpad, and flow. Also, users have access to a dedicated point-of-contact and the company recently launched a multi-currency feature.The rapid growth of Plus and adoption of these new features have been significant growth drivers.What's ExpectedIn its Q1 report, SHOP issued upside guidance for Q2, seeing revenue of $345-$350 mln. The consensus is at the high end of that range at $350.5 mln. Analysts are anticipating SHOP to report EPS of $0.02.Gross merchandise volume (GMV) and monthly recurring revenue (MRR) are two other key metrics to monitor. Last quarter, GMV increased 50% to $11.9 bln following a 54% surge in Q4. MRR increased 36% to $44.2, essentially inline with Q4's growth rate.While profitability hasn't been the main focus of investors during this hyper-growth stage, it has become more of an issue as SHOP's valuation has ballooned. Although the profit margin was very slim, SHOP did report positive Adj. net income of $10.3 mln in Q1, up from $4.2 mln in 1Q18.Guidance: In order to meet analysts' Q3 expectations, SHOP will need to guide for EPS of $0.11 and revenue of $375 mln. In its Q1 report, SHOP issued inline guidance for FY19, projecting revenue of $1.48-$1.50 bln. It also raised its operating income guidance to $20-$30 mln from $10-$20 mln.Quick Take: SHOP's track record of exceeding expectations and its enduring high double digit growth rates are equally impressive. Given the meteoric valuation, the bar is high once again as the stock is priced for perfection. So far, though, SHOP has delivered the exceptional results that investors have come to expect.13:57SCANX Mid cap notable movers of interest -- Granite Construction (GVA) sinks following second quarter warning -Technical-The following are some of today's most notable mid cap movers of interest ($2 bln - $10 bln market cap), ranked by % change (all stocks over 100K average daily volume).Mid Cap GainersMEDP (79.79 +17.89%): Topped consensus for Q2 EPS and revs (+25.8% yr/yr to $214.1 mln) and raised its guidance for FY19 EPS and revs above consensus. There hasn't been much buying conviction in the broader market, although the small-cap Russell 2000 (+0.5%) has seen some positive action. The Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 0.2%, and the Nasdaq Composite is down 0.4%.Several factors that have contributed to the negative disposition include President Trump saying there are no signs of China buying U.S. agricultural products, some cautious trading ahead of Apple's (AAPL 208.08, -1.59, -0.8%) earnings report after the close and the Fed's rate decision tomorrow, and the disappointing price action in shares of Beyond Meat (BYND 205.01, -17.12, -7.7%) following its report.Beyond Meat is perhaps more a reflection of how far many stocks, and the stock market to a certain extent, have come in a short period of time. It isn't too surprising to see some broader consolidation -- or to see shares of Beyond Meat attempting a recovery after being down as much as 17% today.The stock market, too, has come off its lows. At this juncture, the utilities (-0.7%), information technology (-0.6%), and consumer discretionary (-0.6%) sectors are underperforming, while the materials (+0.5%), real estate (+0.5%), energy (+0.5%), and consumer staples (+0.4%) sectors are outperforming.In corporate news, Procter & Gamble (PG 121.29, +5.29, +4.6%) and Merck (MRK 83.42, +0.94, +1.1%) both beat top and bottom-line estimates. Shares are up nicely on the results, while shares of fellow Dow component Pfizer (PFE 39.02, -2.44) are down 5.9% after being downgraded at Bank of America/Merrill Lynch and Morgan Stanley. Capital One (COF 89.99, -6.93, -7.2%), meanwhile, is feeling the fallout from a data breach that affected over 100 million customers.Separately, an expectation that interest rates will remain low has prompted Goldman Sachs to raise its S&P 500 2019 year-end target to 3100 and set a 2020 year-end price target of 3400. Currently, the benchmark 10-yr note yield is up one basis point to 2.07%.Reviewing today's economic data, which included the Personal Income and Spending Report for June, the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index for July, the S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for May, and Pending Home Sales for June:Personal income increased 0.4% (Briefing.com consensus 0.4%) while personal spending rose 0.3% (Briefing.com consensus 0.3%) m/m in June. The PCE Price Index was up 0.1%, as expected, and the core PCE price Index, which excludes food and energy, jumped 0.2%, also as expected. On a yr/yr basis, the PCE Price Index held steady at 1.4% while the core PCE Price Index edged up to 1.6% from 1.5% in May.The key takeaway from the report is that it contained decent consumer data and tame inflation data, which is not all that surprising relative to recent data seen of late.The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index surged to 135.7 in July (Briefing.com consensus 125.5) from an upwardly revised 124.3 (from 121.5) in June. That is the highest reading since November 2018 and the third-highest reading since October 2000.The key takeaway from the report is that consumers are optimistic about current and prospective business and labor market conditions, and have improved expectations for their financial outlook. That is a supportive combination that will encourage increased consumer spending activity.The S&P Case-Shiller Home Price Index for May increased 2.4% (Briefing.com consensus 3.5%) after increasing 2.5% in April.Pending Home Sales increased 1.6% in June (Briefing.com consensus +1.0%). Today's reading follows an unrevised increase of 1.1% in May.12:58SCANX Today's biggest % gainers/losers -Technical-The following are today's top 20 percentage gainers and top 20 percentage losers, categorized by sectors (over $300 mln market cap and 100K average daily volume).Today's top 20 % gainers Healthcare: MEDP (79 +16.73%), CMD (91.59 +11.4%)Industrials: TREX (81.56 +19.91%)Consumer Discretionary: CHGG (46.95 +11.71%)Information Technology: ZBRA (218.47 +15.33%), AMKR (9.41 +15.04%), RNG (141.08 +11.84%)Financials: CURO (11.96 +14.34%), OMF (40.8 +14.06%), ONDK (3.47 +13.98%)Energy: CNX (7.54 +21.81%), NBR (2.49 +18.57%), FRAC (5.81 +16.2%), SWN (2.21 +15.71%), CJ (10.33 +14.78%), OIS (14.77 +12.97%), SLCA (11.62 +12.82%), NE (1.99 +11.8%), RRC (5.32 +11.3%), AR (4.49 +11.01%)Today's top 20 % losers Healthcare: LGND (94.18 -12.35%), HCA (132.71 -9.2%)Materials: BERY (46.35 -16.02%), GLT (15.67 -7.88%)Industrials: GVA (35.91 -19.25%), TBI (18.99 -15.66%), SSD (58.41 -10.65%), R (53.45 -9.9%)Consumer Discretionary: DORM (71.81 -13.4%), UA (21.17 -13.2%), UAA (24.18 -11.88%), GTX (13.23 -11.21%), GRUB (72.76 -8.74%), TACO (11.83 -7.87%)Information Technology: IT (137.82 -19.27%), SSNC (50.5 -15.4%), CVLT (44.59 -11.62%), APPF (94.15 -8.75%), CASA (6.26 -8.35%)Energy: MDR (6.25 -38%)12:51LGND Ligand Pharma slides 12% to multi-year low as GAAP results, pipeline commentary overshadow top-line and Non-GAAP EPS beat (94.48 -12.97)As covered this morning, Ligand reported Q2 Adj-earnings of $0.68 per share, $0.13 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.55; revenues fell 72.2% year/year to $24.99 mln vs the $21.01 mln S&P Capital IQ Consensus. GAAP EPS was ($0.74) vs. the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.66. The second quarter of 2019 net loss was affected by a non-cash change in the value of Ligand's investment in Viking Therapeutics (VKTX) of $12.4 mln.Additionally, as part of its earnings release and conference call, the company provided several updates that appear to be rattling investors:Metavant has been working with FDA to determine a path forward for the glucagon receptor antagonist or GRA program now known as RVT-1502 in diabetes. Ligand believes that continued development of RVT-1502 for diabetes in the U.S. is highly unlikely based on preclinical and clinical trials now required by FDA for any drug in the GRA class intended for long-term use. Metavant may choose to explore certain other indications and/or geographies for RVT-1502 and expects to make a decision later this year.On the call, Ligand provided several updates to its OmniAb platform:Says 35-plus partners are currently running over 170 discovery campaignsHas over $900 mln of total OmniAb potential milestones under contractSays OmniAb business is performing better than expected...trends are generally "very positive", but not all contracts they've signed are still active. Co has seen attrition with some contracts terminated or essentially inactive. Points to M&A activity as number one factor for this...Provides example that deals with Stemcentrx and ARMO, both which were acquired, were not renewed. Additionally, Celgene (CELG) is inactive now, and co expects that due to Bristol-Myers (BMY) acquisition, the deal will not be renewed either... Co moved to remind investors that partner figures are net of attrition. Believes that first Ligand OmniAb antibody could be on the market by the end of 2021 or 2022.As part of today's release, Ligand reaffirmed its 2019 outlook for revenues and Adj-EPS. Separately, as of June 30, Ligand had cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments of $1.3 bln. On the call, the company said that outside of repurchases, it is continually evaluating other uses of capital such as dividends, convertible bond retirements, and more. Following the report, H.C. Wainwright reflected on the company's results by reiterating its Buy rating and $214 price target.Also on investors minds, Lemelson Capital Management, publicly critical of the company for years, announced that it had increased its short position in Ligand and called on the US Attorney's office for the Southern District of California to investigate the company for alleged criminal violations of federal securities laws amidst what it has called SEC failures. Worth noting that Lemelson has been charged by the SEC in connection with its prior commentary on Ligand, but has denied all charges and says it is actively defending the matter.Ligand shares are down 30% YTD, and now down 66% from their late 2018 highs. A bloated balance sheet, poor M&A decision making, management miss steps and a slow down in the business led to a steady decline in shares from late 2016 until late 2018. Shares of GE would fall from $31 to $6 over that time frame. The stock has shown signs of finding a bottom though and has actually outpaced the markets in 2019, rallying nearly 40% off the December lows. Analysts suggested that the share price may have rallied too aggressively given the issues that confront the company. Variables ranging from losses at its GE Capital unit, Boeing (BA) slow downs for aviation, weakness in the Power unit and restructuring make it difficult for analysts to model. Further color on these issues will be welcomed by investors. Free Cash Flow (FCF) will be a key metric to follow. GE has forecast FCF at an outflow of (-$2 bln)- ($-1bln) in Q2. Analysts are looking for the company to beat these expectations as the outlook is being viewed as overly cautious. In Q1, GE reported a FCF outflow of (-$884 bln) which was better than feared. GE stated that it expects FCF to return to positive territory in 2020 and to accelerate thereafter in 2021. There are some concerns about restructuring charges that has some analysts questioning this outlook. We would also note that GE has had a run of beat and lowering expectations in this metric which is obviously an odd dynamic.In addition, GE has announced a number of deals in the quarter which has investors excited about the top line growth. This comes at a time were there is growing competition in many of GE's key industries. There are concerns that the orders are coming at reduced pricing which could impact margins. To wit, GE's outlook for margin expansion of flat to up 100 bps is in question. This could also be reflected in the FCF.Below is a recap of key guidance levels to watch, a recap of Q1 results (broken down by segment) and an update on recent divestiture news.GuidanceRevenues- Low Single Digit to Mid Single DigitsFree Cash Flow- (-$2.0)- $0 bln.Margins- Expansion of flat to up 100 bps.EPS- $0.50-0.60 (Adjusted); Restructuring is expected to weigh on GAAP EPS by $0.22-0.25.The 73 MAX groundings are expected to have a $200-300 mln impact on cash flows. GE has said it does not expect a recovery in the power market in the near term. GE has said it does not expect to achieve double digit cash flow margins for at least three years.Q1 RecapGE reported Q1 (Mar) earnings of $0.14 per share, excluding non-recurring items, $0.05 better than the S&P Capital IQ Consensus of $0.09. The OCS was used to reduce the ischemic injury, monitor continuously, and assess the function of the donor lungs from the time they left the donor body until they were transplanted successfully into matched recipients. The first pair of lungs was transplanted in North Carolina 20+ hours after retrieval from a donor in Hawaii. The exact prevalence of WHIM syndrome is unknown, however, in the United States alone there are between 15,000 and 100,000 patients classified as having a primary immunodeficiency disease of unknown origin -- of which WHIM syndrome is one.
